title: KCl enthalpy - expression for enthalpy of reaction

content.description:
K(s)+ ½ Cl2(g) → KCl(s)                     ΔH° = -437kJ/molrxn

The elements K and Cl react directly to form the compound KCl according to the equation above. Refer to the information above and the table below to answer the questions that follow.
content.question:
Cl2(g) + 2e- → 2Cl-(g)
Which of the following expressions is equivalent to ΔHo for the reaction represented above?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
